AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Juventino Mejia-Orosco: defendant convicted of illegally transporting aliens into the United States, smuggler, sentenced to 10 months in prison and fined $4,000, pled guilty to one count of illegally transporting an alien, previously convicted of unlawful entry, potentially considered an organizer or leader in a criminal activity, found by the district court to be 'an organizer, leader, manager, or supervisor', status as a "manager" is a question of fact for the jury
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.CLARK: Chief Judge presiding over the case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hector Galvencio Paz-Ortega: passenger and citizen of Guatemala, related to Juventino Mejia-Orosco, alien being smuggled
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Carlos Enrique Cruz-Morales: passenger and citizen of Guatemala, related to Juventino Mejia-Orosco, alien being smuggled
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Edward M. Kennedy: Described the sentencing guidelines as a comprehensive approach to reduce disparity in punishment and ensure fair sentences for offenders, victims, and society
